preqs: ATS1312 or HPL1503 and ATS1898 or HPL1504, or equivalent

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {GSC15%, HPL15%, HSY1%, INT1010, INT1020, PLT1%} or  (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ATS1312, ATS1325} and  (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ATS1326, ATS1898, HPL1504} or  Must have passed 12 (I/W) credit points at levels {1} in discipline {090198, 090305})))
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ATS2570, GSC4503%, HPL4503%}

description: This unit provides an historical approach to the study of international relations, incorporating an array of theoretical perspectives and conceptual tools. The focus of the unit will be upon the evolution of the international political system, engaging directly with the question of inevitability of war, the nature of a balance of power and prospects for peace. Students will examine issues such as the significance of states, the meaning and scope of sovereignty, and effectiveness of international law.
